TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UInt16Converter extends System.ComponentModel.BaseNumberConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert 16-bit unsigned integer objects to and from other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a 16-bit unsigned integer object to and from a string.
The <xref:System.UInt16> value type represents unsigned integers with values ranging from 0 to 65535. This data type is not supported in Visual Basic.
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of a UInt16Converter. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example converts a variable of type <xref:System.UInt16> to a string and vice versa.
[!code-cs[Converters#23](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._64_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Converters#23](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._64_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Converters#23](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.componentmodel._64_1.cpp)]
